text: Whoever, having been charged with an offence and released on bail or on bond without sureties, fails without sufficient cause (the burden of proving which lies upon him) to appear in Court in accordance with the terms of the bail or bond, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: ‘Coin’ defined
text: Coin is metal used as money, stamped and issued by the authority of some State or Sovereign Power in order to be so used.

title: Counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting Indian coin
text: Whoever counterfeits, or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of any die or instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that it is intended to be used, for counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin
text: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of any die or instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that it is intended to be used, for counterfeiting Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever is in possession of any instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin, or knowing or having reason to believe that such instrument or material is intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetting in India the counterfeiting out of India of coin
text: Whoever abets the counterfeiting of coin out of India shall be punished in the same manner as if he abetted the counterfeiting of such coin in India.

title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
text: Whoever imports into India, or exports therefrom, any counterfeit coin, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeits of Indian coin
text: Whoever imports into India, or exports therefrom, any counterfeit Indian coin, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
text: Whoever, having any counterfeit coin which, at the time when he became possessed of it, he knew to be counterfeit, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of Indian coin, possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
text: Whoever, having any counterfeit Indian coin which, at the time when he became possessed of it, he knew to be counterfeit, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of coin as genuine, which, when first possessed, the deliverer did not know to be counterfeit
text: Whoever delivers to any other person as genuine or attempts to induce another person to receive as genuine any counterfeit coin, which when he first possessed it, he did not know to be counterfeit, but afterwards discovered to be so, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
text: Whoever has in his possession any counterfeit coin, knowing the same to be counterfeit, and intending to use the same as genuine, or that it may be used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
text: Whoever has in his possession any counterfeit Indian coin, knowing the same to be counterfeit and intending to use the same as genuine or that it may be used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition from that fixed by law
text: Whoever, being employed in any mint lawfully established in India, does any act or omits what he is legally bound to do, so that any coin issued from that mint is of a different weight or composition from that fixed by law, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint
text: Whoever, without lawful authority, takes out of any mint lawfully established in India any coining tool or instrument used for coinage, or any part thereof, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly performs on any coin any operation which diminishes the weight or alters the composition of that coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin
text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly performs on any Indian coin any operation which diminishes the weight or alters the composition of that coin, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
text: Whoever performs on any coin any operation intending thereby to alter the appearance of that coin so that it may pass as a coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
text: Whoever performs on any Indian coin any operation intending thereby to alter the appearance of that coin so that it may pass as a coin of a different description, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of coin, possessed with knowledge that it is altered
text: Whoever, having coin in his possession with respect to which he knows or has reason to believe that any such operation as is referred to in Section 246, 247, 248 or 249 has been performed, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers that coin to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
text: Whenever an assembly of five or more persons has been lawfully commanded to disperse, if any person knowingly joins or continues in such assembly, he shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to, or obstructs, any public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, when suppressing a riot, or when lawfully employed for the preservation of peace, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot
text: Whoever intentionally gives provocation to any person intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause the offence of rioting, or cause such person to break the public peace, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; and if rioting be committed in consequence of the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony
text: Whoever promotes or attempts to promote, on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, caste or community or any other ground whatsoever, disharmony or feelings of enmity, hatred or ill-will between different religious, racial, language or regional groups or castes or communities, by words, either spoken or written, or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and if the act causes or is likely to cause a breach of the public peace, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Imputations, assertions prejudicial to national-integration
text: Whoever makes or publishes any imputation, assertion or statement which is prejudicial to the national integration shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to, or obstructs, any public servant in the discharge of his public functions shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Use of criminal force to deter public servant from discharging his duty
text: Whoever uses criminal force to any person with intent to deter that person from discharging his public duty shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any public servant in the discharge of his public functions shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Threatening public servant to deter him from discharging his duty
text: Whoever threatens to cause injury to any person, with intent to deter that person from discharging his public duty, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Threatening injury to public servant's property to deter him from discharging his duty
text: Whoever threatens to cause injury to any property belonging to a public servant, with intent to deter him from discharging his duty, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using threatening language to deter public servant from discharging his duty
text: Whoever uses threatening language to deter a public servant from discharging his duty shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Being member of an assembly armed with deadly weapon
text: Whoever, being a member of any assembly of five or more persons, is armed with any deadly weapon, or with anything which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect document with intent to cause injury
text: Whoever, being a public servant, makes any incorrect document or record, with intent to cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant disobeying law with intent to cause injury
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly disobeys any direction of the law with intent to cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect record
text: Whoever, being a public servant, fraudulently or dishonestly makes or alters any record or document with intent to cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Threatening public servant to prevent him from acting in his office
text: Whoever threatens a public servant with injury to his person, reputation or property, with intent to prevent him from acting in his office, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect document knowingly
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly omits to make a true entry in any record or document shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant disobeying law with intent to cause injury
text: Whoever, being a public servant, willfully disobeys any direction of the law, with intent to cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect record to save person from punishment
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly frames any incorrect record or document with intent to save any person from punishment or legal proceedings, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect record to save person from legal proceedings
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly frames any incorrect document or record to save any person from legal proceedings shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect document knowingly to cause injury
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly omits or frames any incorrect document with intent to cause injury shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Document serving as record of evidence, when given in evidence, to be presumed genuine unless the contrary is proved
text: Any document purporting to be a record of evidence given in any judicial proceeding, when produced in such proceeding, shall be presumed genuine unless the contrary is proved.

title: Using false document as genuine
text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document which he knows to be false shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
text: Whoever forges a valuable security, will, deed or other document with intent to cause damage or injury to the public or any person shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing any instrument for counterfeiting seal, etc.
text: Whoever makes or possesses any instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting any seal, stamp or other instrument used for authenticating documents shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
text: Whoever commits the offence of secretly disposing of the dead body of a child under circumstances that the birth has been concealed shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Concealment of birth by secreting death of child
text: Whoever intentionally conceals the birth of a child by secreting or disposing of the dead body of the child shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
text: Whoever causes any evidence of the commission of an offence to disappear with intent to screen the offender, or gives any false information to screen the offender shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Furnishing false information with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
text: Whoever knowingly gives false information intending that a public servant shall use his lawful power to the injury of another person shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Concealing commission of offences
text: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that an offence has been committed, conceals the commission of such offence shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using false document with intent to injure public servant in discharge of his public functions
text: Whoever fraudulently uses or causes to be used any false document with intent to injure or intimidate a public servant in the discharge of his public functions shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using false document to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
text: Whoever fraudulently uses or causes to be used any false document in any judicial proceeding shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
text: Whoever makes any declaration which is by law receivable as evidence, knowing it to be false, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: False information, with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
text: Whoever gives false information, intending that a public servant shall use his lawful power to the injury of another person shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment of false personation in any stage of judicial proceeding
text: Whoever personates another in any stage of a judicial proceeding shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for false statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
text: Whoever, knowing that a false statement has been made in a declaration, causes or procures it to be used as genuine shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
text: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that an offence has been committed, gives false information respecting that offence shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any public servant in the discharge of his public functions shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
text: Whoever makes any declaration which is by law receivable as evidence, knowing it to be false, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
text: Whoever, knowing that, by an order duly promulgated by a public servant lawfully empowered to promulgate such order, he is required to abstain from a certain act, or to take certain order with certain property in his possession or under his management, disobeys such direction shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Threat of injury to public servant
text: Whoever threatens to cause injury to any public servant in the discharge of his duty shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
text: Whoever holds out any threat of injury to any person for the purpose of inducing that person to refrain or desist from making a legal application for protection against any injury to any public servant lawfully empowered as such to give such protection, or to cause such protection to be given, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Giving false evidence
text: Whoever, being legally bound by an oath or by an express provision of law to state the truth or to make a declaration upon any subject, makes any statement which is false, and which he either knows or believes to be false or does not believe to be true, is said to give false evidence.

title: Fabricating false evidence
text: Whoever causes any circumstance to exist or makes any false entry in any record or record book, or alters any document or record, or uses any false document or record, intending that the fabrication shall appear such evidence as aforesaid, shall be punished as if he had given false evidence.

title: Punishment for false evidence
text: Whoever intentionally gives false evidence shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
text: Whoever gives or fabricates false evidence with intent to procure the conviction of any person of any offence which is capital by the law for the time being in force, shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine, if the innocent person be thereby convicted and executed.

title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment
text: Whoever gives or fabricates false evidence with intent to procure the conviction of an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Threatening any person to give false evidence
text: Whoever threatens any person in order that he may give false evidence, or to induce him to omit giving evidence, shall be punished in the same manner as if he were giving false evidence.

title: Using evidence known to be false
text: Whoever knowingly uses any evidence which he knows to be false, in any stage of any judicial proceeding, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Issuing or signing false certificate
text: Whoever, being a public servant, issues or signs any certificate he knows to be false, intending that it shall be used to the injury of any person, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using as true a certificate known to be false
text: Whoever uses as true any certificate which he knows to be false shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
text: Whoever makes any false statement to any person upon any subject, which statement he knows or believes to be false and which under the law is admissible as evidence, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false
text: Whoever uses any such statement which he knows to be false as true in any stage of any judicial proceeding shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information, to screen offender—if a capital offence
text: Whoever causes any evidence of the commission of a capital offence to disappear, or gives any false information, intending thereby to screen the offender from legal punishment, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform
text: Whoever, being legally bound to give information of an offence which he is legally bound to do, intentionally omits to give such information, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
text: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that an offence has been committed, gives any false information thereof to any public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Destruction of document to prevent its production as evidence
text: Whoever, knowing that any document required or intended to be produced as evidence in a judicial proceeding, destroys that document or causes it to be destroyed, with intent to prevent it being produced as evidence, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine.

title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly personates any person, for the purpose of doing any act in any suit or proceeding in any Court, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
text: Whoever fraudulently removes or conceals any property to prevent it being seized as forfeited or in execution under any decree or order, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution
text: Whoever fraudulently claims any property as his own, to prevent it from being seized as forfeited or in satisfaction of any decree or order, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
text: Whoever fraudulently causes or suffers a decree to be passed against himself for a sum not due, or for a larger sum than is due, or for any property not due, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonestly making false claim in Court
text: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly, or with intent to injure or annoy any person, makes in a Court of Justice any claim which he knows to be false, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due
text: Whoever fraudulently obtains a decree or order against any person for a sum not due, or for any property not due, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had fraudulently suffered such decree or order to be passed against himself.

title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
text: Whoever, with intent to cause injury to any person, institutes or causes to be instituted any criminal proceeding against that person, or falsely charges any person with having committed an offence, knowing that there is no just or lawful ground for such proceeding or charge against that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; and if such criminal proceeding be instituted on a false charge of an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for seven years or more, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Harbouring offender
text: Whoever harbours or conceals a person whom he knows or has reason to believe to be an offender with the intention of screening him from legal punishment, shall be punished depending on the gravity of the original offence, ranging from three to seven years imprisonment or fine, or both. Specific clauses apply if the original offence is capital or punishable with life imprisonment.

title: Taking gift to screen an offender from punishment
text: Whoever accepts or agrees to accept any gratification under the pretence or on account of screening any person from legal punishment, shall be punished with imprisonment depending on whether the offence is capital, punishable with life, or lesser.

title: Offering gift or restoration of property in consideration of screening offender
text: Whoever gives or offers any gratification or restores property in consideration of screening any person from legal punishment shall be punished accordingly, based on the gravity of the offence involved.

title: Taking gift to help to recover stolen property, etc.
text: Whoever takes or agrees to take any gratification under the pretence of helping any person to recover stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody
text: Whoever, knowing or having reason to believe that any person has escaped from custody, harbours such person shall be punished depending on the nature of the offence committed by the escaped person.

title: Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits
text: Whoever harbours robbers or dacoits knowing or having reason to believe that they belong to a gang shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: [Repealed]
text: This section has been repealed and is no longer in effect.

title: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment
text: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly disobeys any direction of the law as to the way in which he is to conduct himself to save any person from legal punishment shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect record with intent to save person
text: Whoever, being a public servant, and charged with the preparation of any record or writing, frames that record or writing in a manner which he knows to be incorrect, with intent to cause, or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause, loss or injury, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report, etc., contrary to law
text: Whoever, being a public servant corruptly or maliciously makes or pronounces in any stage of a judicial proceeding any report, order, verdict, or decision which he knows to be contrary to law, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Confinement by person having authority who knows it to be contrary to law
text: Whoever, being in any office which gives him legal authority to commit persons for trial or to confinement, corruptly or maliciously commits any person for trial or confinement, knowing that he is acting contrary to law, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Intentional omission to apprehend
text: Whoever, being a public servant legally bound to apprehend or keep in confinement any person under sentence of a Court of Justice for an offence, intentionally omits to apprehend or allows escape, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to seven years.

title: Omission to apprehend person lawfully committed
text: Similar to Section 221, applied when the person is lawfully committed to custody and the omission leads to escape.

title: Escape from confinement negligently suffered by public servant
text: Whoever, being a public servant legally bound to keep in confinement any person charged with or convicted of any offence, negligently suffers such person to escape, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
text: Whoever intentionally offers resistance or illegally obstructs his own lawful apprehension shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or fine, or both.

title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
text: Whoever intentionally offers resistance or illegal obstruction to the lawful apprehension of another person shall be punished with up to two years of imprisonment or fine or both.

title: Omission to apprehend or sufferance of escape
text: Provides punishment for public servants who omit to apprehend or allow escape of persons not covered by previous sections.

title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension not otherwise provided
text: Punishment for any resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension or rescue not otherwise provided shall be simple imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: [Repealed]
text: This section has been repealed and is no longer applicable.

title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
text: Whoever, having accepted a conditional remission of punishment, knowingly violates any condition on which the remission was granted, shall be punished with the punishment to which he was originally sentenced.

title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant during judicial proceeding
text: Whoever intentionally offers any insult or causes any interruption to any public servant while such public servant is sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences
text: Whoever prints or publishes the name or any matter which may make known the identity of any person against whom an offence under sections 376, 376A, 376B, 376C, or 376D is alleged or found to have been committed, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Personation of a juror or assessor
text: Whoever, by personation or otherwise, sits or serves as a juror or assessor, knowing that he is not entitled to do so, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Failure by person released on bail or bond to appear in Court
text: Whoever, having been released on bail or bond by a Court, fails without sufficient cause to appear in Court shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Coin defined
text: Coin is defined as metal used for money stamped and issued by authority of Government for the purpose of being used as money. Indian coin means coin issued by the Government of India for circulation in India.

title: Counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting coin shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting Indian coin
text: Whoever counterfeits, or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of any die or instrument for the purpose of being used, or knowing or having reason to believe that it is intended to be used, for the purpose of counterfeiting coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Indian coin
text: Whoever makes or mends, or performs any part of the process of making or mending, or buys, sells or disposes of any die or instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting coin
text: Whoever is in possession of any instrument or material for the purpose of using the same for counterfeiting coin, or knowing or having reason to believe that the same is intended to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; if the coin to be counterfeited is Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetting in India the counterfeiting out of India of coin
text: Whoever, being within India, abets the counterfeiting of coin out of India, shall be punished in the same manner as if he abetted the counterfeiting of such coin within India.

title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
text: Whoever imports into India, or exports therefrom, any counterfeit coin, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeit Indian coin
text: Whoever imports into India, or exports therefrom, any counterfeit coin which he knows or has reason to believe to be a counterfeit of Indian coin, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of counterfeit coin knowing it is counterfeit
text: Whoever, having any counterfeit coin which he knew to be counterfeit when he became possessed of it, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of counterfeit Indian coin knowing it is counterfeit
text: Whoever, having any counterfeit coin which is a counterfeit of Indian coin and which he knew to be counterfeit when he became possessed of it, fraudulently or with intent that fraud may be committed, delivers the same to any person, or attempts to induce any person to receive it, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Public nuisance
text: Any person who causes injury, danger, or annoyance to the public or to persons who dwell or occupy property in the vicinity is guilty of a public nuisance.

title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
text: Whoever unlawfully or negligently does any act which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
text: Whoever malignantly does any act which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Disobedience to quarantine rule
text: Whoever knowingly disobeys any rule made and promulgated by the Government for putting any vessel into a state of quarantine, or for regulating the intercourse of vessels in a state of quarantine with the shore or with other vessels, or for regulating the intercourse between places where an infectious disease prevails and other places, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
text: Whoever adulterates any article of food or drink so as to make such article noxious as food or drink, intending to sell such article as food or drink, or knowing it to be likely that the same will be sold as food or drink, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Sale of noxious food or drink
text: Whoever sells, or offers or exposes for sale, as food or drink, any article which has been rendered or has become noxious, or is in a state unfit for food or drink, knowing or having reason to believe that the same is noxious as food or drink, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Sale of adulterated food or drink as genuine
text: Whoever sells or offers for sale any adulterated article of food or drink as genuine, or any food or drink intentionally substituted wholly or in part by another article, shall be punished in like manner as if he had sold such article knowing it to be adulterated.

title: Sale of food or drink containing any added substance
text: Whoever sells, or offers or exposes for sale, as food or drink, any article of food or drink which contains any added poison or other ingredient which is injurious to health, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees or with both.

title: Sale of noxious food or drink to animals
text: Whoever sells, or offers or exposes for sale, any article of food or drink as fit for human consumption, knowing or having reason to believe that same is noxious when taken by animals, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees or with both.

title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
text: Whoever vitiates the water of any public spring or reservoir so as to make it less fit for the purpose for which it is ordinarily used, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Making atmosphere noxious to health
text: Whoever voluntarily corrupts the atmosphere in any place so as to make it noxious to the health of persons in general dwelling or carrying on business in the neighborhood or passing along a public way, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
text: Whoever drives any vehicle, or rides, on any public way in a manner so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or to be likely to cause hurt or injury to any other person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Endangering life or personal safety of others
text: Whoever neglects to provide for the safety of passengers and others on any railway train, carriage, vessel or ascending ropeway, or by any mechanical contrivance, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing injury by doing any rash or negligent act
text: Whoever does any rash or negligent act which is not endangering human life or personal safety, but which causes hurt to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing hurt by means of poison etc., with no intent to commit an offence
text: Whoever administers any stupefying or overpowering substance to any person without intent to commit an offence, with intent to cause hurt, discomfort, or risk to health, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation
text: Whoever causes any danger or obstruction in any public way or line of navigation, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
text: Whoever, voluntarily or negligently, does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life, or the personal safety of others in relation to any mechanical contrivance, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
text: Whoever, in any place, negligently does anything which is likely to cause fire or explosion, and thereby endangers human life, or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to dangerous substances
text: Whoever neglects to provide for the safe custody of any dangerous substance likely to cause hurt if not properly kept shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to weapon
text: Whoever keeps or carries any weapon or instrument of a dangerous nature in such a manner as to endanger human life, or to cause hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
text: Whoever keeps any animal so negligently as to endanger human life, or to cause hurt or injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to firebrand or explosive substance
text: Whoever, knowing that any firebrand or explosive substance is likely to cause hurt or danger to any person, voluntarily or negligently does anything so as to endanger human life, or cause hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for public nuisance
text: Whoever commits a public nuisance shall be punished with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees; and, if the nuisance causes danger to human life, health or safety, shall additionally be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale of noxious or deleterious articles
text: Whoever sells any noxious or deleterious food or drink as a beverage or potable article, knowing or having reason to believe the same to be noxious or deleterious, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.
text: Whoever sells, etc., or exhibits in any public place, any obscene book, pamphlet, paper, drawing, painting, representation or figure, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale, etc., of obscene objects to young person
text: Whoever sells, lets to hire, distributes, exhibits or circulates any obscene object to any person under the age of twenty years, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Culpable homicide
text: Whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the knowledge that the act is likely to cause death, but without any excuse for incurring such risk, is said to cause culpable homicide.

title: Murder
text: Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done— (a) with the intention of causing death; or (b) with the intention of causing such bodily injury as the offender knows to be likely to cause death; or (c) with the intention of causing bodily injury sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death; or (d) with the knowledge that the act is so imminently dangerous that it must, in all probability, cause death, and commits it without any excuse for incurring the risk. Explanation and exceptions follow.

title: Murder
text: Except in the cases hereinafter excepted, culpable homicide is murder, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or if it is done with the intention of causing such bodily injury as the offender knows to be likely to cause the death of the person to whom the harm is caused, or if it is done with the intention of causing bodily injury to any person and the bodily injury intended to be inflicted is sufficient in the ordinary course of nature to cause death, or if the person committing the act knows that it is so imminently dangerous that it must, in all probability, cause death or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death, and commits such act without any excuse for incurring the risk of causing death or such injury as aforesaid.

title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
text: If a person, by doing anything which he intends or knows to be likely to cause death, commits culpable homicide by causing the death of any person, whose death he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause, the culpable homicide committed by the offender is of the description of which it would have been if he had caused the death of the person whose death he intended or knew himself to be likely to cause.

title: Punishment for murder
text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for murder by life-convict
text: Whoever, being under sentence of imprisonment for life, commits murder, shall be punished with death.

title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
text: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine, if the act by which the death is caused is done with the intention of causing death, or of causing such bodily injury as is likely to cause death; or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both, if the act is done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause death, but without any intention to cause death, or to cause such bodily injury as is likely to cause death.

title: Causing death by negligence
text: Whoever causes the death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dowry death
text: Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry, such death shall be called 'dowry death', and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death and shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.

title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
text: If any person under eighteen years of age, any insane person, any delirious person, any idiot, or any person in a state of intoxication commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of suicide
text: If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to murder
text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge, and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, the offender shall be liable either to imprisonment for life, or to such punishment as is hereinbefore mentioned.

title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
text: Whoever does any act with such intention or knowledge and under such circumstances that, if he by that act caused death, he would be guilty of culpable homicide not amounting to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and if hurt is caused to any person by such act, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Attempt to commit suicide
text: Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards the commission of such offence, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Thug
text: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, shall have been habitually associated with any other or others for the purpose of committing robbery or child-stealing by means of or accompanied with murder, is a thug.

title: Punishment
text: Whoever is a thug, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing miscarriage
text: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry shall, if such miscarriage be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both; and if the woman be quick with child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
text: Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section without the consent of the woman, whether the woman is quick with child or not, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
text: Whoever, with intent to cause the miscarriage of a woman with child, does any act which causes the death of such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine; if act is done without the consent of the woman, shall be punished either with imprisonment for life, or with the punishment above mentioned.

title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive or to cause it to die after birth
text: Whoever before the birth of any child does any act with the intention of thereby preventing that child from being born alive or causing it to die after its birth, and does by such act prevent that child from being born alive, or causes it to die after its birth, shall, if such act be not caused in good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the mother, be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
text: Whoever does any act under such circumstances, that if he thereby caused death he would be guilty of culpable homicide, and does by such act cause the death of a quick unborn child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years, by parent or person having care of it
text: Whoever being the father or mother of a child under the age of twelve years, or having the care of such child, shall expose or leave such child in any place with the intention of wholly abandoning such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
text: Whoever, by secretly burying or otherwise disposing of the dead body of a child whether such child die before or after or during its birth, intentionally conceals or endeavors to conceal the birth of such child, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Hurt
text: Whoever causes bodily pain, disease or infirmity to any person is said to cause hurt.

title: Grievous hurt
text: The following kinds of hurt only are designated as 'grievous': (1) Emasculation; (2) Permanent privation of the sight of either eye; (3) Permanent privation of the hearing of either ear; (4) Privation of any member or joint; (5) Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint; (6) Permanent disfiguration of the head or face; (7) Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth; (8) Any hurt which endangers life or which causes the sufferer to be during the space of twenty days in severe bodily pain, or unable to follow his ordinary pursuits.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt
text: Whoever does any act with the intention of thereby causing hurt to any person, or with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause hurt to any person, and does thereby cause hurt to any person, is said 'voluntarily to cause hurt'.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt, if the hurt which he intends to cause or knows himself to be likely to cause is grievous hurt, and if the hurt which he causes is grievous hurt, is said 'voluntarily to cause grievous hurt'.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
text: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 334, voluntarily causes hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
text: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 334, voluntarily causes hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or by means of any poison or any corrosive substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which it is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
text: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 335, voluntarily causes grievous hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
text: Whoever, except in the case provided for by section 335, voluntarily causes grievous hurt by means of any instrument for shooting, stabbing or cutting, or any instrument which, used as a weapon of offence, is likely to cause death, or by means of fire or any heated substance, or by means of any poison or any corrosive substance, or by means of any explosive substance, or by means of any substance which it is deleterious to the human body to inhale, to swallow, or to receive into the blood, or by means of any animal, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by use of acid, etc.
text: Whoever causes permanent or partial damage or deformity to, or burns or maims or disfigures or disables, any part or parts of the body of a person or causes grievous hurt by throwing acid or administering acid to that person, or by using any other means with the intention of causing or with the knowledge that he is likely to cause such injury or hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than ten years but which may extend to imprisonment for life, and with fine.

title: Voluntarily throwing or attempting to throw acid
text: Whoever throws or attempts to throw acid on any person or attempts to administer acid to any person, or attempts to use any other means, with the intention of causing permanent or partial damage or deformity or burns or maiming or disfigurement or disability or grievous hurt to that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than five years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal to an act
text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt, for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer any property or valuable security, or of constraining the sufferer or any person interested in such sufferer to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
text: Whoever administers to or causes to be taken by any person any poison or any stupefying, intoxicating or unwholesome drug, or other thing with intent to cause hurt to such person, or with intent to commit or to facilitate the commission of an offence or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby cause hurt, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer any property or valuable security, or of constraining the sufferer or any person interested in such sufferer to do anything which is illegal or which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of constraining the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for the purpose of extorting from the sufferer or from any person interested in the sufferer any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of constraining the sufferer or any person interested in the sufferer to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty
text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to any person being a public servant in the discharge of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person or any other public servant from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by that person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, if he neither intends nor knows himself to be likely to cause grievous hurt to any person other than the person who gave the provocation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to four years, or with fine which may extend to two thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
text: Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred and fifty rupees, or with both.

title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
text: Whoever causes hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
text: Whoever causes grievous hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Wrongful restraint
text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed, is said wrongfully to restrain that person.

title: Wrongful confinement
text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person in such a manner as to prevent that person from proceeding beyond certain circumscribing limits, is said 'wrongfully to confine' that person.

title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for three days or more, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for ten days or more, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
text: Whoever keeps any person in wrongful confinement, knowing that a writ for the liberation of that person has been duly issued, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years in addition to any term of imprisonment to which he may be liable under any other section of this Chapter.

title: Wrongful confinement in secret
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person in such manner as to indicate an intention that the confinement of such person may not be known to any person interested in the person so confined, or to any public servant, or that the place of such confinement may not be known to or discovered by any such person or public servant as hereinbefore mentioned, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years in addition to any other punishment to which he may be liable for such wrongful confinement.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the person confined or from any person interested in the person confined any property or valuable security, or of constraining the person confined or any person interested in such person to do anything illegal or to give any information which may facilitate the commission of an offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the person confined or any person interested in the person confined any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of constraining the person confined or any person interested in the person confined to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Force
text: A person is said to use force to another if he causes motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion to that other, or if he causes to any substance such motion, or change of motion, or cessation of motion as brings that substance into contact with any part of that other's body, or with anything which that other is wearing or carrying, or with anything so situated that such contact affects that other's sense of feeling: Provided that the person causing the motion, or change of motion, or cessation of motion, causes that motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion in one of the three ways hereinafter described.

title: Criminal force
text: Whoever intentionally uses force to any person, without that person's consent, in order to the committing of any offence, or intending by the use of such force to cause, or knowing it to be likely that by the use of such force he will cause injury, fear or annoyance to the person to whom the force is used, is said to use criminal force to that other.

title: Assault
text: Whoever makes any gesture, or any preparation intending or knowing it to be likely that such gesture or preparation will cause any person present to apprehend that he who makes that gesture or preparation is about to use criminal force to that person, is said to commit an assault.

title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person being a public servant in the execution of his duty as such public servant, or with intent to prevent or deter that person from discharging his duty as such public servant, or in consequence of anything done or attempted to be done by such person in the lawful discharge of his duty as such public servant, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault of criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman, intending to outrage or knowing it to be likely that he will thereby outrage her modesty, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than one year but which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment
text: A man committing any of the following acts: (i) physical contact and advances involving unwelcome and explicit sexual overtures; or (ii) a demand or request for sexual favours; or (iii) showing pornography against the will of a woman; or (iv) making sexually coloured remarks, shall be guilty of the offence of sexual harassment and shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
text: Any man who assaults or uses criminal force to any woman or abets such act with the intention of disrobing or compelling her to be naked, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than three years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voyeurism
text: Any man who watches, or captures the image of a woman engaging in a private act in circumstances where she would usually have the expectation of not being observed either by the perpetrator or by any other person at the behest of the perpetrator or disseminates such image shall be punished on first conviction with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than one year, but which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine, and be punished on a second or subsequent conviction, with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than three years, but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Stalking
text: Any man who follows a woman and contacts, or attempts to contact such woman to foster personal interaction repeatedly despite a clear indication of disinterest by such woman, or monitors the use by a woman of the internet, email or any other form of electronic communication, commits the offence of stalking and shall be punished on first conviction with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine; and be punished on a second or subsequent conviction, with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, intending thereby to dishonour that person, otherwise than on grave and sudden provocation given by that person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person, in attempting to commit theft on any property which that person is then wearing or carrying, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
